sà
sound of wind; valiant; melancholy
шум ветра; доблестный; меланхолия
rtega_mnemonic:
颯颯RS
飒飒		sound of the wind, bleak, melancholy, sudden
  • person suddenly standing 立 in a bleak landscape listening to the sound of the wind 風/风
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 飒)
Pictophonetic: 立 indicates the sound; 風 (wind) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
颯颯 [ sà sà ]: soughing; whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
颯爽 [ sà shuǎng ]: heroic; valiant
颯爽英姿 [ sà shuǎng yīng zī ]: bold and brave (idiom)
颯然 [ sà rán ]: soughing (of the wind)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 立 [ lì ] to stand; to establish, to set up
    • 風 [ fēng ] wind; air; customs, manners; news
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you stand in the wind it will be really quick to knock you over. So quick that you probably won't even know the wind did it. You'll end up standing up again just to be knocked over again, just as quick.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine how quick the wind knocks you over when you stand up. So quick, you don't even remember being up. Try again and try to count how many seconds it takes for it to knock you down. Less than one. Now that's quick.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The wind was so quick to knock you down that you sat (さつ) down instead. The wind may be quick, but it can't knock you down if you've already sat yourself.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture how quick you sat down. Even faster than the quick wind. Nice job!
Ru_Meaning: sudden, quick, sound of the wind
Ru_trainchinese: sà: (графема) свист (напр., ветра); сильный, доблестный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wind (風) stands up (立) smoothly
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wind " to " stand " sound. The original meaning is wind. "Said Wen": "Sa, Xiangfeng also. From the wind, stand up." Duan Yucai according to "Wen Xuan. "Feng Fu" Li Shan's note and "Guang Yun" are changed to "Sa, the wind is also". Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Nine songs. "Mountain Ghost": "The wind is rustling and the wood is dying, and the son of thinking is sorrowful." Liang Shenyue of the Southern Dynasty, "On the stage to look at the autumn moon": "The leaves screamed in the evening on the forest, and the Yanmen left early." Later it was used to describe it. The sound of rain, as in the Tang Dynasty Du Fu's "Song of Qian Yuanzhong's Residence in Tonggu County": "The four mountains are windy and the rivers are rushing, and the cold rain is rustling and the trees are wet."

" Sa " also means decline and aging. For example, in the Southern Dynasties Liang Lusuo's "Sitian Fu": "The clouds and evenings of the year will suddenly change, and the grass will wilt." Cen Shen of the Tang Dynasty" Cang."
humanum_short_description_en: From " wind " to " stand " sound. The original meaning is wind.
humanum_full_description:
從「風」，「立」聲。本義是風聲。《說文》：「颯，翔風也。从風，立聲。」段玉裁據《文選．風賦》李善注及《廣韻》改為「颯，風聲也」。如《楚辭．九歌．山鬼》：「風颯颯兮木蕭蕭，思公子兮徒離憂。」南朝梁沈約〈登臺望秋月〉：「上林晚葉颯颯鳴，鴈門早鴻離離度。」後又用來形容雨聲，如唐代杜甫〈乾元中寓居同谷縣作歌〉：「四山多風溪水急，寒雨颯颯枯樹濕。」

　　「颯」也表示衰落、衰老。如南朝梁陸倕〈思田賦〉：「歲聿忽其云暮，庭草颯以萎黃。」唐代岑參〈陪狄員外早秋登府西樓〉：「知己猶未報，鬢毛颯已蒼。」

從「 風 」，「 立 」聲。本義是風聲。《說文》：「颯，翔風也。从風，立聲。」段玉裁據《文選．風賦》李善注及《廣韻》改為「颯，風聲也」。如《楚辭．九歌．山鬼》：「風颯颯兮木蕭蕭，思公子兮徒離憂。」南朝梁沈約〈登臺望秋月〉：「上林晚葉颯颯鳴，鴈門早鴻離離度。」後又用來形容雨聲，如唐代杜甫〈乾元中寓居同谷縣作歌〉：「四山多風溪水急，寒雨颯颯枯樹濕。」 「 颯 」也表示衰落、衰老。如南朝梁陸倕〈思田賦〉：「歲聿忽其云暮，庭草颯以萎黃。」唐代岑參〈陪狄員外早秋登府西樓〉：「知己猶未報，鬢毛颯已蒼。」
From " wind" to " stand" sound. The original meaning is wind. "Said Wen": "Sa, Xiangfeng also. From the wind, stand up." Duan Yucai according to "Wen Xuan. "Feng Fu" Li Shan's note and "Guang Yun" are changed to "Sa, the wind is also". Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Nine songs. "Mountain Ghost": "The wind is rustling and the wood is dying, and the son of thinking is sorrowful." Liang Shenyue of the Southern Dynasty, "On the stage to look at the autumn moon": "The leaves screamed in the evening on the forest, and the Yanmen left early." Later it was used to describe it. The sound of rain, as in the Tang Dynasty Du Fu's "Song of Qian Yuanzhong's Residence in Tonggu County": "The four mountains are windy and the rivers are rushing, and the cold rain is rustling and the trees are wet." " Sa" also means decline and aging. For example, in the Southern Dynasties Liang Lusuo's "Sitian Fu": "The clouds and evenings of the year will suddenly change, and the grass will wilt." Cen Shen of the Tang Dynasty" Cang."

颯字的基本解释

颯
sà
见“飒”。

颯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sà］
［《廣韻》蘇合切，入合，心。］
“飒1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)象声词。风声。
(2)迅疾貌。
(3)形容迅速而至。
(4)大风吹物。
(5)指风微微吹过。
(6)拂拭而过。
(7)衰败零乱。
(8)忽；顿然。
[②]［lì］
［《集韻》力入切，入緝，來。］
“飒2”的繁体字。
(1)见“颯2飁”。
(2)人名用字。汉有朔方太守田飒。见《後汉书·光武帝纪下》。

颯字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【風字部】　颯； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1412第17
【唐韻】蘇合切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】悉合切，?音趿。【說文】翔風也。　又風聲。【宋玉·風賦】有風颯然而至。【杜甫·寓同谷歌】四山多風溪水急，寒雨颯颯枯樹溼。　又衰颯。【杜甫·夔府書懷詩】白首颯淒其。【岑參詩】鬢毛颯已蒼。　又䬃沓，衆盛貌。【顏延之·詠史詩】賔御紛颯沓，鞍馬光照地。　又【集韻】蘇谷切，音速。義同。　又【集韻】【正韻】?力入切，音立。【五音集韻】颯飁，大風。　又【正韻】人名。前漢有劉颯，後漢有衞颯。　【字彙補】或作䬃。

颯字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sà］
["Guangyun" Su He cut, enters he, heart. ]
Traditional characters for "飒1". Also called "1".
(1) Onomatopoeia. Wind.
(2) Quick appearance.
(3) Describe coming quickly.
(4) The wind blows things.
(5) Refers to the breeze blowing slightly.
(6) Wipe away.
(7) Decline and disorder.
(8) Suddenly; suddenly.
[②]［lì］
["Jiyun" cuts hard, enters the arrest, come. ]
"飒2" in traditional characters.
(1) See "Sa 2 Sa".
(2) Use characters for names. In the Han Dynasty, there was Shuo Fang Tai Shou Tian Sa. See "Book of the Later Han Dynasty·The Second Record of Emperor Guangwu".

Name meaning

sà, lì
the sound of the wind; bleak; melancholy
Radicals: 立, 風  (stand, wind)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you stand in the wind it will be really quick to knock you over. So quick that you probably won't even know the wind did it. You'll end up standing up again just to be knocked over again, just as quick.
Imagine how quick the wind knocks you over when you stand up. So quick, you don't even remember being up. Try again and try to count how many seconds it takes for it to knock you down. Less than one. Now that's quick.
Reading Mnemonic
The wind was so quick to knock you down that you sat (さつ) down instead. The wind may be quick, but it can't knock you down if you've already sat yourself.
Picture how quick you sat down. Even faster than the quick wind. Nice job!
